message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with routing algorithms on a graph constructed from a set of points and line segments, which is a classic problem in computational geometry and graph theory. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CG (Computational Geometry) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the use of local information in routing, which falls under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Finally, the paper mentions the use of competitive analysis, which is a topic in cs.IT (Information Theory).
